plugins.description:
Beta 0.1

Hi there! I built this plugin to solve a problem I face every day: transferring text styles between Figma files.

This simple solution helps you quickly capture text styles from one file and paste them into another, maintaining all the original properties. No more recreating styles from scratch or dealing with inconsistencies!

It's still in early beta (version 0.1), but it already saves me tons of time, and I hope it helps you too.

Key features:


One-click text style capture

Select which styles to transfer

Persistent storage between sessions

Clean, modern interface


I'd love to hear your feedback! If you encounter any bugs or have suggestions for improvements, please let me know. I'm actively working on making this plugin better.

If you find this helpful and want to support further development, you can buy me a coffee.

Thanks for trying it out!

plugins.name: IcoSun
plugins.description:
What is Icosun?

Icosun is an open sourced replacement for Icomoon. Its a tool that allows you to convert SVG icons into web fonts. It ensures icons are scalable, accessible, and efficient for web and app development


What does the plugin export?

  1. Source SVGs - A folder containing all raw SVGs used to generate the font files. Ideal for mobile tech stacks that don't support font files as an icon input.
  2. JSON Unicode Map - A key-value mapping between icon names and the unicode values, making it easy to reference icons in your code.
  3. TypeScript Unicode Map - A TypeScript constant that maps SVGs to their unicode representations, allowing direct usage in TypeScript projects.
  4. Combined SVG - A merged single SVG file that links path data to the unicode values, providing a visual reference for your font set.
  5. Font Files - IcoSun generates all major font file formats, ensuring compatibility across different platforms. It outputs TTF, EOT, OTF, WOFF and WOFF2.


What makes IcoSun different?

  1. Duplicate Prevention - IcoSun detects duplicate icons and warns you before export, reducing manual errors in large icon sets.
  2. Simulate Output - SVG-to-font conversion often faces path-winding issues, leading to incorrect subtractions. With IcoSun, you can preview the final output inside Figma before exporting, minimizing unexpected rendering issues.


IcoSun is fully open source, feel free to make changes to the logic as you like 😀
plugins.tagline: Generet font file for your icon library

plugins.name: BizTag - Name Tag Generator
plugins.description:
Automating the name tag design process


Conferences, case comps, and hackathons make up the highlights of many student's time in universities. Why? Because they combine hands-on learning, creativity, teamwork, networking, and the thrill of solving real-world challenges in a lively, collaborative environment.


If you've ever attended one of these events, you might notice that professional partners have name tags around their neck. Designing these name tags can take hours of manual work to make the layouts consistent and audit for content mistakes. But what if all that work could be done with the click of a button?


Meet BizTag


BizTag is a powerful Figma plugin that is built by a designer, for designers. The app communicates with Figma's Plugin API to build a series of clean, customizable, and organized name tags.


All it takes is a background image with a resolution of your choosing, and a .csv file populated with information on your event partners, and you can generate dozens of name tags instantly. The plugin automatically places name, company, and pronouns on the frontside, and generates a QR code to place on the backside using a QR code API.


Each frame comes with auto layout, enabling ease of customizability for the designer.


Schema


The schema is as follows:


type Partner = {
firstname: string;
lastname: string;
position: string; // Position @ Company
pronouns: string; // etc. They / Them
linkedin: string; // LinkedIn Profile URL
};

type PartnerList = Partner[];


where the .json / .csv file is taken as a single PartnerList object.
plugins.tagline: Automate your graphic design process

plugins.name: IconPilot
plugins.description:
🚀 IconPilot: The Ultimate Icon Management Plugin for Your Design System!


Say goodbye to hours of manual work prepping icons for your design system. IconPilot simplifies converting your individual stroke and outline icons into fully customizable multi-variant components in seconds, streamlining your workflow and maintaining consistency across your design system.


✨ Key Use Cases:

  1. Quickly convert hundreds of stroke or outline icons into organized multi-variant components.
  2. Define custom sizes, stroke widths, and colors once—then apply effortlessly across your entire icon set.
  3. Maintain design consistency using Figma variables to automatically sync icon properties.


🔧 Seamless Workflow:

  1. Select your icons (components or frames).
  2. Set variant names, sizes, stroke widths, and colors (raw values or Figma variables).
  3. Click convert—IconPilot instantly generates neatly organized icon components ready for your design system.


💡 Powerful Features:

  1. Bulk convert from single icons to thousands at once.
  2. Intelligent Figma variables filtering—only relevant variables appear for size, stroke, or color fields.
  3. Auto-generated search-friendly descriptions to effortlessly find icons in assets.
  4. Persistent configurations—set once, reuse endlessly within your file.
  5. Figma-native UX for seamless integration into your workflow.


Elevate your design system management. Try IconPilot now and spend your valuable time designing, not managing icons.

accepted.name: Tony Yemelyanov
accepted.description: Product designer

plugins.tagline: Convert individual icons into multi-variant component sets quickly and consistently.

plugins.name: FrameSwapper | Frame to Component
plugins.description:
✨Overview

FrameSwapper is a powerful Figma plugin that helps you replace multiple frames with the same name with a selected component. Perfect for design system implementation and large-scale design updates.


✨ Key Features

  1. 🔍 Smart frame detection: Automatically finds all frames with the same name
  2. 🖼️ Visual preview: Shows thumbnails of both frames and components
  3. ⚡ Batch replacement: Replace multiple frames at once
  4. 🎨 Component integrity: Maintains original component dimensions and properties
  5. 🔎 Search functionality: Quickly find components by name
  6. 📱 Clean UI: Modern, intuitive interface


🛠️ How It Works

  1. Select any frame in your design
  2. Click "Find Matching Frames" to detect similar frames
  3. Choose which frames to replace (or use "Select All")
  4. Pick a component from the available list
  5. Click "Replace" to transform your frames


💡 Use Cases

  1. Implementing design system components across multiple frames
  2. Updating old designs with new component versions
  3. Standardizing repeated elements across your design
  4. Converting prototype frames into component instances


🆕 Version 1.0.0 Updates

  1. Initial release with core functionality
  2. Smart component replacement system
  3. Visual preview system
  4. Search and filter capabilities
  5. Batch selection and replacement
  6. Modern, user-friendly interface

plugins.name: Bulletproof Icons
plugins.description:
🎯 Bulletproof icons


A simple figma plugin to quickly create what I call "Bulletproof" icons for your icon libraries.


Tired of readjusting your icon component layers, so that they don't break in your design? Using different icon from different icon libraries? This plugin will solve the problem of creating consistent icon components.


What does it do?

This plugin will make layer structure for all of your icon like this:


Frame/

├── Union

│ ├──Vector

├── Original


So, when you change color of your icon, resize it or do any other modification, and then change the icon component to another one your modifications won't reset or break. They will be consistent no matter what you do.


How to use?

It's so simple! There's no UI, just select one or multiple frames (not vectors) and run the plugin.

plugins.name: HypoGen: Simplify Hypothesis Creation in Figma
plugins.description:
HypoGen is a Figma plugin designed to streamline hypothesis generation, making it easy for designers and product teams to turn ideas into clear, testable statements. With simple prompts, HypoGen guides users to articulate their goals, assumptions, and expected outcomes, helping teams create well-structured hypotheses for design experiments and product improvements.


What You’ll Find:

•Guided Input Fields: Fill in prompts that help you clarify the problem, proposed solution, and expected impact.

•Instant Hypothesis Notes: Generate neatly formatted hypotheses directly on your Figma canvas, keeping ideas accessible and organized within your design environment.

•Consistent Structure: Follow a standardized hypothesis framework, ensuring your team’s testing approach is clear, goal-oriented, and easy to measure.


What You’ll Learn:

•How to Define Clear Hypotheses: Learn to break down design ideas into structured hypotheses that are actionable and focused on measurable results.

•Hypothesis-Driven Design Thinking: Incorporate hypothesis-based thinking into your design process, empowering you to test assumptions and make data-informed decisions with confidence.

•Effective Experimentation Practices: Develop hypotheses that drive meaningful experiments, improving your product iteratively with a user-centered approach.


Make your design decisions testable with HypoGen—create hypotheses effortlessly and start building with purpose.

accepted.description:

From idea to market 🚀
Design team @ ASSIST Software

plugins.name: Framenizer - Organize frames with ease
plugins.description:
Framenizer is a Figma plugin designed to help you organize and manage your frames with ease. Whether you are working on a design system or a simple prototype, it streamlines your workflow by automatically organizing your frames.


Key features

  1. Automatic frame arrangement: Quickly organize your frames in either horizontal or vertical layouts with just a few clicks.
  2. Consistent spacing: Maintain a clean and professional look with consistent spacing between all your frames.
  3. Section titles: Add descriptive titles to your frame groups for better organization and documentation.
  4. Section wrapping: Group related frames together by wrapping them in dedicated sections.
  5. Naming options: Choose between preserving your original frame names or using automatic naming conventions.
  6. Support and feedback: Constantly improving the plugin based on your input.


Need help or have suggestions?

I am always looking to improve the plugin. If you have any questions, encounter issues, or have ideas for new features, please don't hesitate to reach out to me at achmadalimin.com or Linkedin.

plugins.name: Gene UI Tokens Hub
plugins.description:
Gene UI Tokens Hub

Streamline your design-to-development workflow with Gene UI Tokens Hub, a Figma plugin that connects your design system tokens to your GitHub repository.


Key Features

  1. Sync Figma variables and explore them using JSON tree and variable collections filters
  2. Connect to GitHub and push changes to your style dictionary package
  3. Generate CSS3 and JavaScript variables from your design tokens


Benefits

  1. Automate the process of converting tokens into code
  2. Ensure consistency across your design system, design, and development teams
  3. Save time and reduce errors during the sync process of tokens


How it Works

  1. Install the Gene UI Tokens Hub plugin in your Figma account
  2. Make changes in Figma built-in variables and use it in your design styles
  3. Open the Gene UI Tokens Hub, and connect your GitHub repository to the plugin
  4. Review your changes and push them to your GitHub repository, where your style dictionary package will be generated

plugins.name: Orange Tokens: Theme & Tokens
plugins.description:
Description

Orange Tokens helps you turn any base color into a full set of tints and shades — instantly and intelligently. Now with Typography Token support, you can generate consistent, scalable color and type systems right inside Figma.


Whether you're building a new design system or scaling an existing one, Orange Tokens eliminates guesswork and manual setup — so you can focus on design, not variables.


No more manual tweaks or guesswork — Orange Tokens helps you scale your colors the smart way.


🚀 How to use

  1. Enter your base colors and name them
  2. Choose how many display/text styles you want
  3. Click “Generate Variables”
  4. Orange Tokens generates color variables and synced text styles automatically


✨ Features

  1. One-click color palette generation
  2. Auto-generated tints & shades from base colors
  3. Typography tokens + text styles generated together
  4. Organized variables with design token–friendly naming
  5. Great for theming, dark/light modes, and scalable systems
  6. Fast, clean, and easy — even at scale


⚙️ How it works

Orange Tokens uses structured algorithms to create harmonious tints, shades, and typography styles from your input. Each color or text style is mapped to a logical name and stored as a Figma variable — ready for use across your entire system.


Everything updates in a few clicks — no broken styles, no messy overrides.


💬 Feedback and feature ideas?

This is just the beginning — future updates will explore typography tokens, spacing, mode support, and more. Have an idea or request? Email me at inamdar.chinmay25@gmail.com, or leave a comment on the plugin page!
plugins.tagline: Design Token Generator for Color & Typography

plugins.name: Stroke Manager
plugins.description:
Stroke Manager is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you efficiently manage stroke properties across multiple elements simultaneously. Perfect for designers who work with illustrations, icons, wireframes, or any vector content.


Key Features


  1. Batch Update Strokes: Modify stroke width, alignment, and end caps across multiple elements at once
  2. Smart Color Management: Map colors individually or override all strokes with a single color
  3. End Point Styling: Quickly apply different cap styles (round, square, arrow)
  4. Nested Elements: Apply changes to parent elements and all their children with a single click
  5. Color Detection: Intelligently groups similar colors to simplify your workflow


Why You'll Love It

Save valuable time by updating dozens or hundreds of stroke properties in seconds instead of tediously modifying each element individually. Stroke Manager is particularly useful when adapting illustrations for different sizes or contexts, ensuring consistent stroke weights and styles throughout your design.

Perfect for design system maintenance, icon libraries, and illustration collections, Stroke Manager helps you maintain visual consistency while dramatically speeding up your workflow.
plugins.tagline: Batch Update Strokes

plugins.name: Chroma UI
plugins.description:
Chroma UI revolutionizes color selection by combining the power of perceptually uniform OKLCH color space with an intuitive interface. Create stunning, accessible palettes that elevate your designs and streamline your workflow.


Create with Confidence

Make color decisions faster with intelligent tools that understand both aesthetics and accessibility. Every palette you generate comes with semantic color naming and WCAG-compliant text color recommendations, helping you build cohesive design systems that scale beautifully.


Professional-Grade Control

  1. Precisely adjust colors using the perceptually uniform OKLCH space, with familiar HEX, RGB, and HSL options
  2. Create smooth, mathematically accurate gradients that maintain consistent luminance
  3. Generate context-aware color names that adapt to your design system
  4. Ensure accessibility with automatic contrast checking and text color suggestions
  5. Export palettes directly to your design tools and documentation
  6. Spark inspiration with curated random palettes based on color theory principles


Essential For

🎨 Design Systems – Build scalable, consistent color foundations

🎯 Brand Identity – Craft memorable, on-brand color palettes

📦 UI Components – Ensure color harmony across your interfaces

📱 Digital Products – Create accessible, high-impact user experiences

💡 Creative Exploration – Experiment with unique, dynamic color schemes


Experience the next evolution in color tools. Chroma UI combines mathematical precision with designer-friendly workflows to help you create better color systems in less time.


Crafted for professional designers and teams who need scientific accuracy without sacrificing creative flexibility. Upgrade your color workflow today with Chroma UI.

plugins.name: Winding Rule Inspector
plugins.description:
Warning: If you don't know what Winding Rules are, you probably don't need this plugin.


If you want to know more about winding rules, follow this link: https://oreillymedia.github.io/Using_SVG/extras/ch06-fill-rule.html


This plugin allows designers to quickly inspect the winding rule of vector objects in Figma. It provides instant feedback about the selected vector's winding rule, helping you understand and manage the rendering behavior of complex vector shapes.


Key features:

- Automatically displays the winding rule of the selected vector object

- Updates in real-time as you select different vector objects

- Provides clear notifications for non-vector selections or when no object is selected

- Runs unobtrusively in the background, allowing you to continue your design work


How to use:

1. Run the plugin

2. Select any vector object in your Figma design

3. A notification will appear showing the winding rule of the selected vector

4. As you select different vector objects, the notification will update automatically


This tool is perfect for designers working with complex vector illustrations, icons, or any projects where precise control over vector rendering is crucial. Understanding the winding rule can help resolve unexpected rendering issues and ensure your vectors display correctly across different platforms and use cases.


Note: This plugin only works with vector objects. Selecting any other type of object will result in a notification indicating that the selected object is not a vector.

accepted.name: Thierry
accepted.description: I am Thierry – a designer, developer, and, typographer based New York. I’ve worked with companies large and small, building and maintaining design systems.

plugins.tagline: This plugin allows designers to quickly inspect the winding rule of vector objects in Figma.

plugins.description:

  1. Match your layer names exactly to your keys inside of your JSON file.
  2. Select the outermost frame/group of the text layers.
  3. Upload your JSON file.

plugins.name: Oz Words
plugins.description:
Introducing Oz Words, the powerful content design plugin for Figma that streamlines your workflow and simplifies your development process.


How to use


  1. Rename the layer's name of your text by starting with "#t." and then follow with words. For example, "#t.back" or "#t.page_a.title"
  2. Open Oz Words Plugin, go to the library of the language you want to edit
  3. Look for the word you want to edit in code, edit and click save
  4. After saving, your text will update automatically


Note

This is our Beta version to test our concept. Please follow us for more updates. We are working on a simpler and user-friendly version and hope it will come out soon. Cheers!
plugins.tagline: With Oz Words, you can create text as components that can be edited and updated with just one click.

plugins.name: Image to Gradient library

Image to Gradient Library lets you instantly convert any image into a reusable gradient preset in Figma with a single click. Extract key colors, fine-tune palettes, and save your custom gradients directly to your styles library—all within seconds.


🚀 Why Use It?

-Convert images into all types of gradients (linear, radial etc.) with a single click

-Shuffle, ignore, or select specific colors for precise control

-Instantly apply gradients to any layer

-Save as reusable styles for consistency across projects


🧠 Who Is It For?

Perfect for designers working with visual storytelling, brand development, or moodboards. Whether you're building a product UI or a campaign visual, turn inspiration into usable assets instantly.


⚡ What Makes It Different

-Intelligent color extraction from any image

-One-click gradient generation

-Customizable gradient types and color filtering

-Native style saving—no copy/paste needed

-Ultra-fast performance with an intuitive UI


🔐 Licensing
